column2: An audacious surprise attack on his predecessor has led to a new title for Tretch and an army to do his bidding.
The monarch of the Undead, the liege of the Unliving.
The ties that hold man and beast together cannot be broken by death alone.
This Liche Priest is so powerful he can tap energy directly from the Realm of Souls and direct it at will.
Effective chariot warfare requires precise control - choreography, almost, if you will - if the victories sought by Unliving generals are to be achieved.
This warrior-king was unmatched in chariot tactics. Only the finest crews served under him - and will again, of course…
Alkhazzar II of the Sixth Dynasty
Lahmizzash continued the fight against Nagash, retaking sacred Khemri with the aid of his potent Ushabti.
Conquering lands beyond the mountains east of Nehekhara, Rakhash was a bringer of great prosperity.
Ruling in the wake of the war with Nagash, Setep restored the Necropolis and the Priesthood to their former glory.
The son of Khetep ruled only briefly before his death, but his grasp of engineering and urban development were legendary.
Wakhaf repelled the nomads and secured the borders. He is a peerless master of desert warfare.
Time itself cannot harm those who have defied death.
This Necrotect knows all the secret hieroglyphic inscriptions required to strengthen his statuary constructs.
The myriad Undead legions respond to their master's will without question.
As the embodiment of the Asp Goddess in full fury, a wave of pure terror rolls over those who look upon her.
The oldest and wisest of the Liche Priests is the head of the Mortuary Cult's hieratic council.
Revered One, Venerable One, Lord of Secrets, High Priest of the Temple of Years…
Unlife is forever; it is therefore prudent to go willingly and prepared.
There are many perfectly-uttered litanies and precise incantations required to draw forth spirits from the Realm of Souls. This one knows them all.
The Vulture-God assists the desert poozler, lest they lose their way 'neath the scorching desert sun.
Imbued with the souls of ancient Liche Priests, Sokth's servants are unhindered by their mechanical bodies of metal and stone.
That which is sculpted in Qu'aph's noble image strikes with the strength of the Serpent-God.
Settra is a brutal warlord and powerful sorcerer combined to deadly effect; ageless, deathless, venomous, and almost entirely without peer.
The stuff of myth and nightmares made stone, and later terrifying, savage reality.
The God of the Scorpions protects the venal, the perfidious, and the downright murderous.
The people of the desert live and die by their oaths in Basth's graceful sight.
Djaf's servants bring brutal, jackal-headed death to his unfortunate foes.
Benevolent Tahoth imparts sacred knowledge and timeless wisdom to his people.
The Tomb Kings and their servants feel Khsar's wrath coursing through their Unliving veins.
There is no-one more devoted to murder than Crone Hellebron, greatest of all Khaine’s brides.
As Everqueen of all Asur, Alarielle is leader of Avelorn and Ulthuan’s spiritual head.
Where Alith Anar stalks, so come the ravens to feast on the carrion in the Shadow King’s wake.
If there's a right way to do something, this one doesn't have the wherewithal to know what it is.
This one is something of an eccentric; their erratic behaviour has upset powerful people, which is seldom a good idea.
Don't take this one along if you need to get away quickly… or maybe you should…
This one doesn't even relax in their own company, so reserved is their nature.
Some things should not have to be endured.
Action, inaction, change - you name it, this one will work against the prevailing wind.
On occasion, throwing the whole nine leagues at the enemy is just the ticket.
Skills refined and improved upon over time can only increase one's edge over the foe.
You don't want to be on the wrong side of this one's ire - it's explosive to say the least!
The very picture of good health. Clearly, there's many years still ahead of them.
Every fibre of their being is charged and ready for action - wherever, whenever.
Impressively energetic for a thousand years old - even by their own reckoning.
Armour is just a formality when you're as hard as nails and as tough as old boots.
This one is not at all easy to kill, and many have tried, believe me.
Hmmm interesting. I do wonder if there's a third way, however…
There's usually a right way and a wrong way to do anything. This one generally gets it wrong.
This one can never leave something alone. They always have to meddle.
Good ideas oft-times need vocal, public support to turn them into reality.
The Daemon is very definitely in the detail…
Armies can be mended as surely as people can, up to a point of course.
This one acts not for themselves but the for the greater good, in defence of the future.
Fortunately, there are some who really apply themselves to the problems of the world. Just as well, otherwise we'd be… Oh wait...
There's always a way - always an angle. You just have to find it.
Never short of new ideas, or new ways of looking at old problems.
An individual of exceptional skill and worth; the very embodiment of sagacity.
I see something wrong and I fix it with my hands.
Definitely one to watch and perhaps align yourself with.
This one has a certain… energy and enthusiasm for the life, which is proving to be infectious.
Years at sea have clearly paid off - this one can clearly 'walk the walk', which has found favour with their crew.
People don't even speak in hushed tones anymore, such is this one's renown.
Aranessa Saltspite is the most feared pirate in all of Sartosa, but none fear her more than the Norscan curs she hunts.
Beautiful and innocent it may be, but all will be consumed by fire in the end. It is written.
Cylostra is a vengeful spirit intent on performing for the Phoenix King, willing to sink all of Ulthuan to achieve her undying goal.
You'd think there wasn't much further to fall, but you'd be wrong - it's a long, long way down to Stromfels' Chest, after all…
Luthor Harkon has made many great cold-blooded enemies in his time, but his Undead army fear - and feel - nothing.
How else is an ordinary, decent pirate to make an honest living in these hard, dark times?
Killing is at the forefront of this one's mind. Hopefully, they also know how to run a ship.
Count Noctilus abandoned Sylvania to become the captain of the Dreadfleet and master of the Galleon's Graveyard; he is the foremost bringer of death upon the high seas.
It takes more than mere muscle to be leader, you must also know how to make money and how to inflict pain - a lot of pain.
There's nothing quite like a good, straightforward plan - and this is nothing like one! Complexity rarely trumps simplicity, in all matters.
Be the cargo powder, steel, gold or flesh, in the final analysis it matters not.
The greatest Corsair since the time of his illustrious grandfather, Lokhir is doing the name of Fellheart proud in every sense.
If you're gonna die, you may as well die with your boots on.
Self-belief is a fine thing when not misplaced.
Deceit is a perfectly acceptable means of attack.
Having a modicum of resolve is useful in a world that continually tests it.
Always in control, this one leaves no stone unturned and nothing to chance.
Being fleet of foot is useful in a fight… or when trying to get away afterwards!
Sharp minds make sharp blades sharper still.
What this being doesn't know probably isn't worth knowing, so deep is their interest in the world and its ways.
Although actually reading minds is not in their skillset, this one has extraordinary insight into the motives of others.
This being has a plan - not just a game plan, but a master plan to achieve their long-term aims.
Careful planning, knowledge of the terrain and the weaknesses of the enemy are the key to victory.
Rugged, resistant, and almost unbreakable, this being can and will take on all comers.
If you can swing, slash, stab, gouge, or shoot it, this warrior has mastered every aspect of its use.
Some beings just don't know when to put the bottle down.
More than mere bloodlust, this one is filled with the primal, Ruinous rage of the Lord of Battle.
This one has something of the compost heap about them…
The Dark Tongue is an apt medium through which to torment, mock and enrage the foe.
Sometimes, letting so much blood that the soil itself is stained just isn't enough. And it will never be.
Oh, horrific wonder! Vile awe! Such hateful majesty!
Mine desire is all, mortal wretch!
To cause another's suffering, to delight in their pain, to extend their agony according to your whim. That is power.
The Witch King long ago sought to take Ulthuan's crown, but the Flames of Asuryan left him twisted with hatred and horribly scarred.
Evil-minded, poisonous malignancy. For its own sake.
When this one is abroad you can be sure that malice is borne towards anyone and everyone.
I would be so grateful for your cooperation in this, my lord. I do so hate to be... disappointed.
Behind every thought they have - and every deed - is shameless, full-blooded spite.
Some folk call me vicious. I'll scoop out the eyes of any who utter it in my presence.
This brave Dawi can trace his lineage back to Grimnir, the Warrior-God.
This industrious Dawi can trace his lineage back to Grungni, God of Mines and Smiths.
This loyal Dawi can trace his lineage back to Valaya, Goddess of Healing and Protection.
Franz has put his trust in this man; pray he does not let him down!
The thrill of the chase, the tremor as the quarry is cornered, the ecstasy of the kill. These are the things that matter.
If it's got a scent and footprints, I'll find it. Also, it helps if it's absolutely huge and can be spotted a league away.
The smallfolk should be thankful - without us, who would they work for?
A regal air? Let's see how long that lasts.
Someday he's gonna be a Boss. Can you believe someday we'll work for 'im?
When you're clearly betterer than all the uvvers you need to shout the loudest, so everybody else knows you're the betterest.
Dat a 'shroom in yer pouch? Give it! Give it to me!
You can't keep a good 'danca' down, especially when those drums start bangin'!
When a Warboss needs someone to talk, he calls on this "Boy wiv da extra pointy sticks".
The white lion's pelt worn by Lord Alastar bears inspiring testament to his great heart and dauntless courage.
This one is something of an eccentric; their erratic behaviour has upset powerful people, which is seldom a good idea.
Don't take this one along if you need to get away quickly… or maybe you should…
Look, it's terribly cold. Can we get those things as far away from me as possible? Yes, that's right - on the flank.
The very illustration of Elven perfection. What a git!
The prospect of battle fills the phoenix with a brisk energy that's somewhat infectious...
Through his words and deeds, this one has made a name for himself within noble Elven circles.
Even for a long-limbed, long-lived Elf, this character is a fine specimen.
Enlightenment is achieved by mastering not only the body, but the soul. Only then can a warrior truly understand the value of life.
Battle, you say? Today? Marvellous! Bring me my phoenix - let's get killing!
It's surprising that this one can even lift a pen, let alone a sword.
There are people living inside Morrslieb - right inside, yes - and they want to take over the world!
Some warriors are like rocks - hard and immovable. This one is like jelly…
This one moves like lightning, ducking and twisting to avoid their opponent's blows.
Chance is like magic - it can be harnessed to the individual's will.
Every fibre of their being is charged and ready for action - wherever, whenever.
Through their veins a charge is racing. Energy, filling the ominous void within.
If you need anything, there are guards outside the doors. Many guards.
Armour is just a formality when you're as hard as nails and as tough as old boots.
In society, one must learn to conform. Or not, as the case may be…
A subversive agitator, and clinically non-conformist to boot.
Good ideas oft-times need vocal, public support to turn them into reality.
Industrious and productive, this one can turn ideas into gold - sometimes literally.
Armies can be mended as surely as people can, up to a point of course.
This one is happy to follow and let other, more energetic types, lead from the front.
Never short of new ideas, or new ways of looking at old problems.
I see something wrong and I fix it with my hands.
Cool, calm, and collected. Yeah, right!
This one doesn't even relax in their own company, so reserved is their nature.
Fortitude? Strength of character? Do me a favour - this yellow-bellied poltroon has none.
Definitely not the life and soul of the party; they exude melancholy and depression.
Tempers, like wicks, can be ignited. Watch the anger burn.
Action, inaction, change - you name it, this one will work against the prevailing wind.
You don't want to be on the wrong side of this one's ire - it's explosive to say the least!
Not every cloud has a silver lining.
Whatever quality is needed to stand guard over the Asur way of life, this one has it in abundance.
If ever there was a candidate for a relaxing break at an all-inclusive spa, it was this one.
Looking "not too well" has become a permanent condition. Clearly, they're lacking essential herbs.
They say two are better than one. They are, of course, totally wrong in every respect.
Chance is like magic - it can be harnessed to the individual's will.
Every fibre of their being is charged and ready for action - wherever, whenever.
Impressively energetic for a thousand years old - even by their own reckoning.
Through their veins a charge is racing. Energy, filling the ominous void within.
Staying this supple takes effort. You don’t get definition like that by sitting about and drinking.
If you need anything, there are guards outside the doors. Many guards.
There's usually a right way and a wrong way to do anything. This one generally gets it wrong.
Machinery - and indeed progress of any kind - is anathema to this one, because there's no substitute for good, honest toil.
This one can never leave something alone. They always have to meddle.
Much of the Ulthuan skyline built over the last thousand years is down to this one’s sterling endeavours.
Too late, too late! will be the cry, when the one with the bargains passes you by.
Fortunately, there are some who really apply themselves to the problems of the world. Just as well, otherwise we'd be… Oh wait...
If it requires accuracy and organisation, this one is your Elf. Not so much fun at parties, however.
There's always a way - always an angle. You just have to find it.
An individual of exceptional skill and worth; the very embodiment of sagacity.
If there's a right way to do something, this one doesn't have the wherewithal to know what it is.
Some things should not have to be endured.
This one doesn't have the stomach for intrigue, let alone war and its privations.
Self-starting is a useful ability; starting others - and keeping them that way - more useful still.
There's nothing quite so impressive - and painful - as a well-timed, well-ordered charge.
Practice really does make perfect, or at least makes it much harder to kill.
On occasion, throwing the whole nine leagues at the enemy is just the ticket.
This one is a driving force; potential is taken and transformed into decisive action by their hand.
Skills refined and improved upon over time can only increase one's edge over the foe.
It's as much effort as this one can make to lift a blade, let alone swing it at an opponent with force.
Bones are not supposed to be on the outside.
Some warriors are like rocks - hard and immovable. This one is like jelly…
This one moves like lightning, ducking and twisting to avoid their opponent's blows.
The very picture of good health. Clearly, there's many years still ahead of them.
Every action is executed seemingly without effort.
You really don't want to be on the receiving end of an attack made by this one. You really don’t.
Armour is just a formality when you're as hard as nails and as tough as old boots.
This one is not at all easy to kill, and many have tried, believe me.
Hmmm interesting. I do wonder if there's a third way, however…
I'm sorry, what? I was looking at that cloud - looks just like Aenarion in a certain light.
Extravagant and dissolute, this one could almost be an honorary Druchii, such is their inclination for excess.
The Daemon is very definitely in the detail…
Come now, let this conflict cease. We're all Asur, remember?
This one acts not for themselves but the for the greater good, in defence of the future.
Whatever the task, this one always wishes to do it to the best of their ability - and better on every occasion thereafter.
This one smooths the way, so differing opinions do not so easily lead to frayed tempers and drawn blades.
The best way to hang on to your gold is never to spend any of it.
There's something of the other world about this one; this cruel plane has failed to engage them.
This one would forget their head if it wasn't, er, attached.
Strategy? Tactics? Piffle, more like. Charrrrgggge!!!
This one understands tactics, and how to vary them, well enough to generally defeat the foe.
Our forefathers followed the way and overcame great adversity. We should not ignore their lessons.
Some minds are more susceptible to magical influence than others, but this one is strong indeed.
Right, are you listening? Good. There's only one way to do things and that's by the book.
Immovable and resolute in their will, this one is as determined as the World Dragon himself!
Action, inaction, change - you name it, this one will work against the prevailing wind.
It's as much effort as this one can make to lift a blade, let alone swing it at an opponent with force.
Bones are not supposed to be on the outside.
Some warriors are like rocks - hard and immovable. This one is like jelly…
This one moves like lightning, ducking and twisting to avoid their opponent's blows.
The very picture of good health. Clearly, there's many years still ahead of them.
Every action is executed seemingly without effort.
You really don't want to be on the receiving end of an attack made by this one. You really don’t.
Armour is just a formality when you're as hard as nails and as tough as old boots.
This one is not at all easy to kill, and many have tried, believe me.
How this… absolute, card-carrying moron has survived this far is anyone's guess, and a mystery to all!
If you want something done, shoot this one first - it'll make your life a lot easier.
Yes, we will hit our own troops, but we'll hit theirs as well. We have reserves. Attack!
If you wish to live, it's best to keep your eyes open and your head down.
You need a plan. Never let anyone tell you otherwise. Devise a plan, then execute it - and preferably the enemy - haha!
Sentiments - and indeed feelings of any kind - are not for public display, in their estimation.
More than skilled, this one shows great proficiency in matters of war.
Their love of shiny things is so great this one could be an honorary Greenskin!
Form, fire, charge, flank, repeat. This one shows that it really can be that simple.
Someone less suited to bodily activity it would be hard to find.
When their army charges towards the foe, this one can clearly be seen legging it in the opposite direction!
Kindness and consideration are virtues. No, really, they are!
Why walk when you can run? Why run when you can fly?
Unswerving and determined, this one is an immovable force on the battlefield.
Revenge is not a dish best served cold; it is always perfectly sweet, no matter the temperature.
You can almost see the hearts fluttering when this one passes by, on their way to derring-do and adventure.
Always animated, this one has an infectious vitality about them.
It's always someone's fault. They can always be made to pay.
It's surprising that this one can even lift a pen, let alone a sword.
This one couldn't hit an Ogre at ten yards, let alone a ravening pack of Skaven!
Locking themselves out of rooms; that bad batch of oysters; the one stray arrow - this one is more than simply unlucky!
This one can hit an Ogre at one hundred yards, and a ravening pack of Skaven at fifty!
Chance is like magic - it can be harnessed to the individual's will.
Always considered, never rushing to judge, all conclusions based on empirical evidence, no conjecture.
There must be runes about their person - no one could be this lucky otherwise!
You have to get up very early if you want to beat this one; nothing escapes their keen eye and lightning reflexes.
The strength at the base of the pillar.
There's dull, boring, and inattentive... and there's this live wire.
Everything is such an effort - they'd much rather feast than fight.
This one would be late for their own funeral pyre if it were possible!
When this one plans an ambush, every possible option is considered. Nothing is left to chance.
In battle, this one is a shining example for others to follow - and the foe to run away from!
Sitting around waiting for something to happen is not their style.
More than keen, this one is positively champing at the bit to get up and at the enemy.
A paragon of martial excellence, with few peers among their own kind, let alone the enemy.
Ever watchful, this one bides their time until precisely the right moment to attack.
As master of the foremost Asur mages, this Elf has studied in their secret libraries longer than most men live.
This body may be frail, but never doubt the strength of the mind, or the heart within it.
Rally to my banner, and we shall bathe the plains with the blood of our enemies!
Self-important and opinionated, this one's hubris knows no end.
Self-effacing and unpresuming, he believes that we all have a part to play in the Great Plan, one way or another.
As the last remaining warrior of the now ruined temple-city of Xhotl, for Kroq-Gar the battle is not yet over.
Oldest and most powerful of the living Mage-Priests, Mazdamundi is a figure of awe even amongst his own kind.
What are you even for? You're not part of the Great Plan, like all your kind.
The Plan is the Plan. We shall not deviate or retreat from its path.
As Right-Claw to Warlord Gnawdwell, Queek Headtaker has risen high within Clan Mors – a credit to the terrible violence he’s unleashed along the way.
I keep them sharp, yes-yes. Always ready for the challenge that I know is coming, yes-yes!
When they come for you, go straight for the throat and tear it clean out. They won't come again.
Rather than weakening with age, Lord Skrolk is possessed with a diabolic vitality that belies the years and the heaped diseases he carries.
By their very nature, rats are very sneaky - even sneakier than Goblins. In fact, they're probably the sneakiest of all.
Most precious of all substances, the pulse of our life.
Glory in your dark majesty, my lord.
Vampires and their liche-servants are devious creatures; manipulative with many mortal servants in their thrall.
They will tremble, my lord, oh, they will fear!
Once forbidden knowledge is acquired, Necromancers and Vampires will jealously guard it from rivals' eyes.
A master indeed - to rival the Great Necromancer himself?
Those whom the Mage Queen has favoured fight as if powered by her hand.
The first arrow of battle must fly truest.
With a roar, it pointed, and a pack of nightmare dog-beasts turned their feral attention towards me.
Into the mud with them, break their skulls and eat their hearts!
“Morghur returns. Morghur spread Gods’ corruption. Many die but all fall to Ruin. ALL!”
By the comet, that is my decree!
The student thrives on heretical knowledge; dark foundations lead to darker, binding deliverance.
Surrender and serve me in life, or die and slave for me in death.
Those whom the Mage Queen has favoured fight as if powered by her hand.
“The forest does not forgive; the forest does not forget. You will all feed its roots in the end, one way or another…”
“Do you understand? You are more than you were – more than just flesh and bone; you are everything that defines us."
The first arrow of battle must fly truest.
“The Throne of the Eight Peaks is mine, by right!”
True King of the Eight Peaks
“The Peaks belong to me. I dare yoo to try and take ‘em from me, stunty.”
“Da Godz speak ta me. Listen, and I’ll tell ya.”
In this age of blood and battle, intellect is an underrated gift.
This victory is not mine alone, we all share in the glory.
Why forlorn? Are you not a king, an emperor - a champion?
A calming presence can be a steadying hand… but also disquieting.
An assured air instils great confidence in your followers.
Others may call it decisive, but being uncompromising can be a weakness as well as a strength.
A figure of awe and inspiration, hers is the will of the goddess.
Atypical of his savage, stupid kind, Throgg is possessed of a grim, malevolent cunning that raises him far above his peers.
Born to slaughter in their Ruinous names, Wulfrik bears the Mark of the Dark Gods upon his flesh.
It's not just the Elves that suffer from this affliction then?
Although the eyes do not see, the other senses remain open.
Only the blood of the wretch will settle this.
Another speech? Very well… does it have to be so… lengthy?
We stand together! I promise I will not leave your side, brothers! Will you join me?
Does a rage as hot as Khorne's burn within?
There are drunk Ogres more sure-footed than this one.
Deformed by birth or made by the Ruinous Powers, yet there is honour within the prison of flesh.
Tzeentch will have so much fun with you, puppet!
Look! Over there - a Snotling showing its arse!
To trap a fool is easy; to trap a King… perhaps even easier.
Such chiselled good looks belie a confidence that a homely face cannot parse.
A humble creature, shamed by praise and thoughtful in their dealings.
In this age of blood and battle, intellect is an underrated gift.
To be crippled by indecision is to give your enemies an advantage.
This victory is not mine alone, we all share in the glory.
Why forlorn? Are you not a King, an Emperor - a champion?
Born in battle, dragged up in war.
A calming presence can be a steadying hand… but also disquieting.
An assured air instils great confidence in your followers.
Such an ugly scar is always memorable.
Clearly a veteran of some heroic deed.
Skulk and sneak or shadow and stalk, theirs is a guileful nature.
Spurned by his allies, this man will struggle to regain favour.
Shares the intellect of a River Troll.
One of the Plague Father's creations perhaps?
Others may call it decisive, but being uncompromising can be a weakness as well as a strength.
Chaste, honourable, and untainted by notions of self-aggrandisement, King Louen is the most virtuous of all the Lady's champions.
A master of the feint and riposte, this Knight's skill at turning an enemy's strength against them is legendary.
Haughty, proud, and skilful, this Knight never takes a backward step in the face of adversity.
No matter the odds, this Knight takes to the field utterly undaunted by the numberless hordes of his enemies.
Most loyal of Companions, this Knight fights always at the side of his Liege.
Unbending even in the face of the greatest beasts, this Knight mounts their heads on the wall of his feasting chamber.
This Knight's skill, prowess, and finesse with blade and lance are beyond compare; his bravery, horsemanship, and chivalry above all others.
In the glory of the charge is this Knight most alive, ever in the forefront of battle.
So great is this Knight's skill with a lance that none can unhorse them.
With a heart of stone and resolute temper this Knight stands unbowed, spilling the foe's blood with each sweep and thrust.
This Knight has great contempt for those who eschew the martial values of meeting one's opponent face to face.
A hermit-Knight, this one nevertheless always returns to fight for his beloved king.
Steeled by this Knight's bravery, those around them fight with the courage of the Breton himself.
I will be the axis upon which the wheel of change turns, and the world will drown in the light of unborn stars.
Oh, horrific wonder! Vile awe! Such hateful majesty!
Mine desire is all, mortal wretch!
The whole world will burn before I rest again.
Surely such sedition should sour and succumb to Sigvald!
This brave Dawi can trace his lineage back to Grimnir, the Warrior God.
This industrious Dawi can trace his lineage back to Grungni, God of Mines and Smiths.
This loyal Dawi can trace his lineage back to Valaya, Goddess of Healing and Protection.
A Dwarf's az is his pride and joy - but what if a Dawi from a rival Clan has a more storied weapon?
This is my edict as High King! Khazukan Kazakit-ha!
Bring me victory, bring me death!
The Wind of Chamon will rise and blast any who get in my way!
Our names will be remembered in our people's songs until the end of time!
Wyverns is good fer one thing, eatin', smashin', smellin' and flyin'.
Dat stabba is longa dan mine!
Some Vampires have an affinity for Necromantic magic beyond their peers.
They flock to you - the ghoul-kind. Direct them as you will.
You and your masters are desiccated relics of a dead age.
My people will feast on your bones.
Only the direst of all Undead creatures will come to this summons.
You and your followers will die - that is my oath as my kin, Grimnir, is witness!
The Undead whole is always stronger than the sum of its parts.
